alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 9:58AM CST until February 26 at 1:20AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tennessee... Elk River Near Prospect affecting Giles and Limestone Counties. For the Elk River...including Prospect...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elk River Near Prospect. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Water completely floods Veto Rd near the Hargrove - Johnson bridge south of Route 273. It may be unsafe to pass and motorists should seek an alternate route. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 26.8 feet and steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CST Friday was 26.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 14.8 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.7 feet on 02/23/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM CST.
